4.56.text: These people are amongst the greatest quiz players in Britain.

9.96.text: Together, they make up the Eggheads,

11.80.text: arguably the most formidable quiz team in the country.

17.20.text: The question is, can they be beaten?

26.00.text: the show where a team of five quiz challengers pit their wits against

29.08.text: possibly the greatest quiz team in Britain.

33.36.text: And a bit of orange going on at both ends, I notice.

41.44.text: Here we go. A fact straight away.

43.72.text: Taking on our quiz champions today

51.12.text: some of them work together and two of them are married,

54.08.text: but they all share one thing in common - they love to quiz.

59.08.text: Hi, my name's Charlotte, and I'm a cover supervisor.

75.36.text:

85.40.text: and we used to quiz together

- the whole Essex-girl thing in the

102.32.text: So you do love to quiz, and as soon as I said that

106.28.text: because they love to take on good teams.

150.84.text:

212.80.text: so I kept my spell as short as I possibly could

1631.68.text: I've nothing. I like the sound of Chris, but I've got nothing.

1635.40.text: You're on your own, but we'll go with it!

1637.36.text:
- Yeah. 
- Well, I'm happy to go with that.

1639.84.text: It's not a fox, it's not a deer.

1641.16.text: Well, three of us have never heard of it,

1642.96.text: but Chris seems certain that it's a bird

1645.04.text: and I'm not going to argue with him, so we'll go for bird.

1649.40.text: I haven't seen it, no, I've read about it.

1653.56.text:
- Mm. 
- The boobrie is said to take the form of a bird.

1657.08.text:
- Well done, Chris. 
- Well done, Chris,

1659.52.text: straight up with that, and we say congratulations, Eggheads -

1669.32.text: I thought you were about to draw a blank there,

1671.68.text: and we were going to have a very interesting wrangle,

1673.96.text: but it didn't happen. They are fearsome at the moment.

1676.40.text:
- I know. 
- Catching them in this form is good jackpot-wise,

1679.64.text: but it's so hard to win, they're just holding on to that money.

1682.56.text:
- I hope you've enjoyed it. 
- We have, thank you. 
- Very much. 
- Thanks so much for coming.

1688.24.text: The Eggheads have done what comes naturally to them

1690.48.text: and this amazing winning streak continues.

1692.76.text: It does mean you won't be going home with the £26,000,

1695.56.text: so the money rolls over to our next show.

1698.52.text: Eggheads, I say well done again, I'm almost tired of saying it.

1702.00.text: No-one will ever beat you, we now know that for sure.

1705.52.text:
- Ever. 
- No, we don't! 
- Join us next time...

1709.04.text: Join us to see if a new team of Challengers have the brains

1711.96.text: to defeat the Eggheads in our next programme.

1714.04.text: There's going to be £27,000 in play.
